page.title: 16LOCAL LANGUAGE DICTIONARY
page.content: {Ain}= own {Mam}= mum {Aye}= yes {Moo}= mouth {Braw}= fine {Morn}= tomorrow {Bricks}= trousers{Neeps}= turnips {Claes}= clothes {Nicht}= night {Clarty}= dirty {Ower}= over {Click}= boyfriend{Puckle}= lot {Cloot}= clothe {Queet}= ankle bone {Coo}= cow {Quine}= girl {Dain}= doing {Sair}= sore {Doon}= down {Sark}= shirt {Ee}= eye { Sciffy}= maid {Foo}= drunk {Scunnered}= fed up {Fower}= four {Sheen}= shoes {Ganzee}= jersey {Siller}= silver {Geets}= children {Snaw}= snow {Goor}= muck {Gweed}= good {This dictionary might {Hose}= socks {help you to read page15 {Iday}= today {We wonder how many of {Ken}= I know {these words will still {Lug}= ear {be used in the future?
